reviewText: Again David Suchet is the perfect Poirot.  Other actors trying to portray this unique detective fall short.  The plots are well thought out and of course the vintage towns, cars and landscapes are fun to view.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I read my first Agatha Christi (And Then There Were None -- also called 10 Little Indians) when I was in 9th grade (1974).  I STILL love them!  She made me love mysteries.  Always entertaining...always intriguing!  The joy of those put to the screen by Clive is that he stays true to Ms. Christi's books -- and Suchet plays the PERFECT Poirot!  These are wonderful and can be watched by the entire family.  There's no open sex, no "f" bombs,  and the murders are not gorey...which makes them great for the kids.  You'll even watch them a second and third and fourth time to pick up on the clues.  The best part -- just like a fairy tale.....at the end, justice prevales and the "good guys" win!  You will not be disappointed...

reviewText: I love the Poirot mysteries.  I have The Classic Collections1 thru 4 and have watched them several times.  Then I get new advertisements for additional mysteries only to check closely and find repeats.  I am disappointed because I want more, new Poirot mysteries and not have to check so closely for duplicate episodes.  The Poirot collections are great, just don't like repeat episodes.
